# addArrangedSubview(_:)

**Instance Method**

Adds a view to the end of the arranged subviews array.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func addArrangedSubview(_ view: UIView)
```

## Parameters

- **view**: The view to add to the array of views arranged by the stack.

## Discussion

The stack view ensures that the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIStackView/arrangedSubviews] array is always a subset of its [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/subviews] array. This method automatically adds the provided view as a subview of the stack view, if it isn’t already. If the view is already a subview, this operation doesn’t alter the subview ordering.

## Related Documentation

- **removeFromSuperview()**: Unlinks the view from its superview and its window, and removes it from the responder chain.
- **init(arrangedSubviews:)**: Returns a new stack view object that manages the provided views.

## Managing arranged subviews

- **arrangedSubviews**: The list of views arranged by the stack view.
- **insertArrangedSubview(_:at:)**: Adds the provided view to the array of arranged subviews at the specified index.
- **removeArrangedSubview(_:)**: Removes the provided view from the stack’s array of arranged subviews.
